member.name: P:C1.Win.C1ChartBase.baseChart.UseGrayscale
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to render the chart with grayscale instead of color.
The use of Grayscale is intended as a preview for output to a black and white device. It does not affect style brush or pen colors internally, only the rendering of the chart to the output device. Using grayscale implies the use of double buffered output.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1ChartBase.baseChart.LayoutLabels

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1ChartBase.baseChartRect.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the element in chart control client coordinates.
member.remarks: The Location property always returns the actual location of the upper, left corner of the chart element it describes whether or not the element placement is manual or automatic. Modifying this value will change LocationDefault.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1ChartBase.baseChartRect.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the element in chart control client coordinates.
member.remarks: The Size property always returns the actual size of the chart element it describes whether or not the element placement is manual or automatic. Modifying this value will change SizeDefault.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1ChartBase.baseChartRect.LocationDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the default location of the element in chart control client coordinates.
member.remarks: The LocationDefault property specifies the location of the upper, left corner of the chart element it describes. Non-negative values indicate the explicit position in chart client coordinates to place the chart element. Negative values will allow auto-positioning.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1ChartBase.baseChartRect.SizeDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size of the element.
member.remarks: The SizeDefault property specifies the size of the chart element it describes. Non-negative values indicate the explicit width and height in chart client coordinates to place the chart element.Negative values will allow auto-positioning.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.C1Chart.LoadChartFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the chart property and data settings (chart description) from the specified file.
member.remarks: This method loads the contents of the specified file in XML format into the chart. The file should contain the output of a call to SaveChartToFile. If an error occurs during the file open, reading or chart drawing, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.C1Chart.LoadChartTemplateFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the chart property and settings (chart description) and images from the specified file.
member.remarks: This method loads the contents of the specified file in XML format into the chart. The file should contain the output of a call to SaveChartTemplateToFile. If chart element images were present at the time the SaveChartTemplateToFile was called, the appropriate images are also reset to the saved values. If an error occurs during the file open, reading or chart drawing, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.C1Chart.LoadChartTemplateFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the chart property and settings (chart description) and images from the specified string.
member.remarks: This method loads the contents of the specified string in XML format into the chart. The string should contain the output of a call to SaveChartTemplateToString. If chart element images were present at the time the SaveChartTemplateToString was called, the appropriate images are also reset to the saved values. If an error occurs during reading or chart drawing, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.C1Chart.LoadChartAndImagesFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the chart property and data settings (chart description) and images from the specified file.
member.remarks: This method loads the contents of the specified file in XML format into the chart. The file should contain the output of a call to SaveChartToFile or SaveChartAndImagesToFile. If the latter method was used to create the load string, then any chart element images are also reset to the saved values. If an error occurs during the file open, reading or chart drawing, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.C1Chart.GenerateHistogramData(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Generates histogram data from an array of raw data and the specified interval boundaries. Count normalization is performed by specifying an appropriate NormalizationWidth.
Although the chart has a Histogram chart type, it is sometimes preferable to generate charts similar to histograms, but with slightly different characteristics. This method is provided as a convenience for these occasions.
member.param: Specifies a double array containing data values.
Specifies the interval boundaries. The boundaries array is sorted internally, and duplication boundaries are eliminated.
Specifies the interval width to be used for normalization. If less than or equal to zero, normalization is not performed.

A reference to a double array which will receive the actual ordered and trimmed boundaries of the intervals making up the histogram. This array is generated internally from the input Boundaries array.

A reference to a double array which will receive the count of data points that fall into the interval specified by the IntervalBounds array. The IntervalCounts array will necessarily have one less element than the IntervalBounds array.

A reference to a two element double array which will receive the count of data points that fall outside the specified Boundaries array. Element zero (0) of the array receives the count of data points with values less than the lowest value in the Boundaries array. Element one (1) of the array receives the count of data points with values greater than the highest value in the Boundaries array.
member.returns: A boolean indicating success or failure.
member.remarks: Each pair of consecutive interval boundary values is used to specify an interval. This results in one less interval than the number of boundary points. For example, boundaries of 1,3,4,5,6 would result in 4 intervals of 1-3, 3-4, 4-5, and 5-6. Note that each interval need not be the same width. When varying widths are specified in the IntervalBounds array, the numeric counts are should be normalized by their area. This means that an interval with twice the width of another interval, but with the same number of data points falling within it, will report half the returned count.
member.exception: Thrown when RawData or Boundaries are null.
Thrown when RawData or Boundaries arrays are too short.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.C1Chart.GenerateHistogramData(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Generates histogram data from raw data and a series of interval boundaries specified by a starting value, an interval width and the number of intervals.
member.param: Specifies a double array containing data values.
Specifies the starting boundary of the first interval.
Specifies the width of each interval.
Specifies the number of consecutive, uniform width intervals.
Specifies the interval width to be used for normalization. If less than or equal to zero, normalization is not performed.

A reference to a double array which will receive the actual ordered and trimmed boundaries of the intervals making up the histogram. This array is generated internally from the input Boundaries array.

A reference to a double array which will receive the count of data points that fall into the interval specified by the IntervalBounds array. The IntervalCounts array will necessarily have one less element than the IntervalBounds array.

A reference to a two element double array which will receive the count of data points that fall outside the specified Boundaries array. Element zero (0) of the array receives the count of data points with values less than the lowest value in the Boundaries array. Element one (1) of the array receives the count of data points with values greater than the highest value in the Boundaries array.
member.returns: A boolean indicating success or failure.
member.remarks:
Each pair of consecutive interval boundary values is used to specify an interval. This results in one less interval than the number of boundary points. For example, if Start=1, IncrementalWidth=2 and Count=4, then intervals bounded by 1,3,5,7,9 are created, resulting in 4 intervals of 1-3, 3-5, 5-7, and 7-9.
Since all intervals are of equal width, it is not necessary to perform interval count normalization when only a single set of data is used. However, if multiple sets of data are used, and different interval widths are supplied, normalization provides a more consistent result.
member.exception: Thrown when the RawData array is too short.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.C1Chart.Repaint
member.summary: Determines whether the chart is repainted when its properties change.
member.remarks: When the Repaint property is false, chart repaints are minimized as chart properties are changed. This is useful when multiple chart properties will be changed in an event, and it is desired to reduce the flicker associated with repeated repaints. Note that it is very important to set Repaint to true when property changes have been completed. Failure to do so can result in a chart that never repaints.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.C1Chart.UseGrayscale
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to render the chart with grayscale instead of color.
The use of Grayscale is intended as a preview for output to a black and white device. It does not affect style brush or pen colors internally, only the rendering of the chart to the output devices and images. Using grayscale implies the use of double buffered output.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.C1Chart.ColorGeneration
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value specifying theme based automatic color generation.
The default value is ColorGeneration.Custom which specifies the standard color generation method used by C1Chart. The remaining options mimic the color themes of Microsoft Office.
A special setting for this property is ColorGeneration.CopyToCustom. When the ColorGeneration property is set to the CopyToCustom value, the current colors are copied to the Custom color generation, and the property is automatically set to ColorGeneration.Custom for further customization. Please note that this operation is automatically performed whenever the chart data is loaded by string, file or by the designer. Please also note that as color customizations are made to the LineStyle and SymbolStyle of each ChartDataSeries, these customizations affect both the current state and the Custom state values.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.AlarmZone.IsInsideZone(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Returns true if the specified client coordinate lies within the shape of the AlarmZone.
AlarmZones may overlap, with one more AlarmZones on top of others. This method returns true as long as the coordinate is within the bounds of the AlarmZone, regardless of whether the AlarmZone is covered by another at the specified coordinate.

member.summary: Gets or sets the near extent of the AlarmZone in X-axis data coordinates.
member.remarks: Typically, the NearExtent is the smaller X value in data coordinates that the AlarmZone extends. If the FarExtent and NearExtent are both zero, then both are assumed to be the Max and Min values of the X-axis, respectively.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.AlarmZone.FarExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the far extent of the AlarmZone in X-axis data coordinates.
member.remarks: Typically, the FarExtent is the larger X value in data coordinates that the AlarmZone extends. If the FarExtent and NearExtent are both zero, then both are assumed to be the Max and Min values of the X-axis, respectively.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.AlarmZone.LowerExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the lower extent of the AlarmZone in Y-axis data coordinates.
member.remarks: Typically, the LowerExtent is the smaller Y value in data coordinates that the AlarmZone extends. If the UpperExtent and LowerExtent are both zero, then both are assumed to be the Max and Min values of the Y-axis, respectively.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.AlarmZone.UpperExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the upper extent of the AlarmZone in Y-axis data coordinates.
member.remarks: Typically, the UpperExtent is the larger Y value in data coordinates that the AlarmZone extends. If the UpperExtent and LowerExtent are both zero, then both are assumed to be the Max and Min values of the Y-axis, respectively.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.AlarmZone.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape of the AlarmZone.
member.remarks: An AlarmZone of rectangle shape is specified by the rectangle bounded by the the data coordinates specified by the extents of the AlarmZone. An AlarmZone of elliptical shape is specified by the rectangle bounded by the the data coordinates specified by the extents of the AlarmZone. An AlarmZone of polygon shape is specified by the data specified of the PolygonData and bounded by the data coordinates specified by the extents of the AlarmZone. Applicable only for Cartesian charts.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.AlarmZone.GroupIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the data group of the AlarmZone.
member.remarks: The group index indicates the ChartGroup for which the AlarmZone extents specify the data coordinates of the AlarmZone. If the group index specifies a non-existent ChartGroup, the AlarmZone is not drawn.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.AlarmZone.MinWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the AlarmZone minimum pixel width.
member.remarks: If the width of the AlarmZone is less than the specified value in pixels, the AlarmZone is drawn with the specified width. Applicable only for Cartesian charts and rectangular or elliptical shaped AlarmZones.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.AlarmZone.MinHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the AlarmZone minimum pixel height.
member.remarks: If the height of the AlarmZone is less than the specified value in pixels, the AlarmZone is drawn with the specified height. Applicable only for Cartesian charts and rectangular or elliptical shaped AlarmZones.

member.remarks: If the AlarmZone is polygon shaped, then this object is used to specify the polygon coordinates using arrays or data series specification. Applicable only for Cartesian charts and polygon shaped AlarmZones.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray
member.summary: Container object for data arrays.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.IsHole(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if the specified value is interpreted as a data hole.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the specified value is interpreted as a data hole.
member.remarks: The value is automatically converted to the internal data type based upon the data type of the value specified. The value is then compared to the stored data hole. Note that invalid floating point data values such as NaN are treated as hole values.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.CopyDataIn(System.Object)
member.summary: Copies data into the ChartDataArray, replacing all existing data.
member.returns: A Boolean value indicating whether the data was appropriately copied into the ChartDataArray.

remarks.para: Although the passed DataArray is an object, the underlying data type must be an array of type Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal or DateTime (VB) or float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal or DateTime (C#). An array of objects is not accepted. When PointData is managed by the ChartDataArray, an array PointF objects may also be passed.

Note that all values are stored as a Double(VB) or double(C#) data type internally. Data conversions are performed automatically and as appropriate for the inputted data type. For example, setting a data element to a DateTime value of January 1, 2002 will be stored internally as an Ole date, then converted to a Double/double with a result of 37257.
Additionally, the length of the copied array defines the length of the ChartDataArray, and the Length property will report the new value.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.CopyDataOut
member.summary: Copies data out of the ChartDataArray using the default data type.
member.returns: An object containing an array of the default type, appropriately converted from the internal Double(VB) or double(C#) values.
member.remarks:
Although the returned array is an object, the underlying data type will be an array of type Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal or DateTime (VB) or float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal or DateTime (C#). When PointData is managed by the ChartDataArray, an array PointF objects may also be returned.
In Visual Basic, it is not necessary to explicitly cast the returned value. The strong typing of C# however, requires an explicit cast.
Note that all values are stored as a Double(VB) or double(C#) data type internally. Data conversions are performed automatically and as appropriate for the default data type.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.CopyDataOut(System.Type)
member.summary: Copies data out of the ChartDataArray using the specified data type.
member.returns: An object containing an array of the specified type, appropriately converted from the internal Double(VB) or double(C#) values.
member.remarks:
Although the returned array is an object, the underlying data type will be an array of type Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal or DateTime (VB) or float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal or DateTime (C#). When PointData is managed by the ChartDataArray, an array PointF objects may also be returned.
In Visual Basic, it is not necessary to explicitly cast the returned value. The strong typing of C# however, requires an explicit cast.
Note that all values are stored as a Double(VB) or double(C#) data type internally. Data conversions are performed automatically and as appropriate for the specified data type.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.Add(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new value to the end of the ChartArrayArray.
member.returns: An integer indicating the index of the new value in the ChartDataArray. The new index is always the Length of the ChartDataArray prior to adding the new value.
member.remarks: The Add method extends the length of the ChartDataArray by one, then adds the new value to the newly created element. The value is automatically converted to the internal storage data type.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.Clear
member.summary: Removes all values from the ChartDataArray.
member.remarks: All elements of the ChartDataArray are removed and the Length is set to 0.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.Contains(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether a value is in the ChartDataArray.
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether the specified value can be found in one of the elements of the ChartDataArray.
member.remarks: The value is automatically converted to the internal data type based upon the data type of the value specified. The value and the elements of the ChartDataArray are then compared using the converted result.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.IndexOf(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the current index of the specified value in the ChartDataArray.
member.returns: Returns an integer indicating the element of the specified value within the ChartDataArray. If the value is not found the return value is â€“1.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts a new value at the specified index of the ChartDataArray.
member.remarks: The value is inserted at the position specified and the length of the ChartDataArray is increased by 1.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the first occurance of the specified value from the ChartDataArray.
member.remarks: The value is automatically converted to the internal data type based upon the data type of the value specified. The value and the elements of the ChartDataArray are then compared using the converted result.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the specified index from the ChartDataArray.
member.param: Index of data value to remove
member.remarks: The element of the ChartDataArray is removed, and the length of the ChartDataArray is decreased by 1.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.DataType
member.summary: Gets or sets the default data type of the data.
member.remarks: Specifies the default data type that is used with the CopyDataOut method. If the default DataType property is not explicitly set, then the reported type is that of the last entered data through either the CopyDataIn method of the Item property. Acceptable input data types include Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal and DateTime (VB) and float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal and DateTime (C#). When PointData is managed by the ChartDataArray, PointF objects may also be used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the data array.
member.remarks: When extending the existing length of the array, the newly created elements are filled with data hole values. When reducing the length of the array, truncated elements are thrown away. Note that it may be necessary to increase the length of an array before setting its values with the Item property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.Hole
member.summary: Returns an Object with the ChartData.Hole value converted to the data type specified by the ChartDataArray.DataType property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.Statistics
member.summary: Gets the object that provides statistics for the data of this ChartDataArray.
member.remarks: The return StatisticalData object contains a number of readonly properties that report Mean, Median, Standard Deviation, Variance and Confidence intervals for the data. PointData ChartDataArrays also include the R-Squared statistic for X-Y data.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the data element by index.

remarks.para: This property can be used to access a specific data entry by numerical index. In Visual Basic, no casting is required. In C#, it is necessary to cast the return value to the appropriate type. Note that all values are stored as a Double(VB) or double(C#) data type internally. Data conversions are performed automatically and as appropriate for the inputted data type. For example, setting a data element to a DateTime value of January 1, 2002 will be stored internally as an Ole date, then converted to a Double/double with a result of 37257.

Acceptable input data types include Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal and DateTime (VB) and float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal and DateTime (C#). When PointData is managed by the ChartDataArray, PointF objects may also be used.
Note that the index must be between 0 and the Length of the array inclusive.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataArray.DataField
member.summary: Gets or sets the data field name that is bound to the ChartDataArray.
member.remarks: The data field name must exist in the DataSource.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.IntervalMethodEnum
member.summary: Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the IntervalCreationMethod property in the ChartHistogram class.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.IntervalMethodEnum.Automatic
member.summary: Interval boundaries and width are calculated based on the data statistics. The number of intervals is an optional input.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.IntervalMethodEnum.SemiAutomatic
member.summary: Starting interval, interval width, and the number of intervals specify interval boundaries.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.IntervalMethodEnum.XDataBoundaries
member.summary: The X data inputs will be used for interval boundaries.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.DisplayTypeEnum
member.summary: Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the DisplayType property in the ChartHistogram class.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram
member.summary: The ChartHistogram class contains properties specific to Histogram charts.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram.DisplayType
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to display the frequency data.
member.remarks: Frequency data can be displayed in a different manner on a per series basis, making it possible to mix display types in a single chart group.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram.IntervalCreationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to specify the histogram intervals.
member.remarks:
Interval boundaries can be established in a variety of ways.
When the Automatic method is used, the chart calculates the upper and lower limits of the intervals using the maximum and minimum data values, and restricting the intervals to lie within 3 standard deviations of the data mean. The number of intervals is optional. Interval boundaries are calculated uniformly.
When the SemiAutomatic method is used, the upper and lower limits of the intervals are specified together with the number of intervals. Interval boundaries are calculated uniformly.
When the XDataBoundaries method is used, the X values of the data data series are used to explicitly set each interval boundary. The X values are sorted and duplicate values are eliminated. Each ascending value of the result is used determine the next interval boundary. Thus, the first and second resulting X values define the first interval and each successive X value specifies the end of the next interval. Note that specification of N intervals requires N+1 unique X values.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram.IntervalNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of intervals in the histogram.
member.remarks: The IntervalNumber property applies only to histograms created with Automatic and SemiAutomatic methods. When the XDataBoundaries method is used, the number of intervals is defined as 1 less than the number of unique X values specified.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram.IntervalStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric value of the beginning of the first interval.
member.remarks: Applies only to the SemiAutomatic creation method.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram.IntervalWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric value of the width of the each interval.
member.remarks: Applies only to the SemiAutomatic creation method.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram.BelowIntervalCount
member.summary: Gets the numeric count of values less than the first interval.
member.remarks: Sometimes a data distribution will contain values that do not fall into any of the specified intervals of a histogram. The number of values numerically less than the starting value of the first interval are returned by the BelowIntervalCount property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram.IntervalBounds
member.summary: Gets the boundary values of each interval used for the histogram.
member.remarks: The IntervalBounds property returns a double array containing the ascending values used for the boundaries of the histogram intervals, regardless of the IntervalCreationMethod used to generate the histogram. The number of elements in the array is necessarily one more than the number of intervals.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram.IntervalCounts
member.summary: Gets the numeric count of values in each interval.
member.remarks: The IntervalCounts property returns a double array containing the count of values that fall within the specified intervals. The number of elements in the array is necessarily one less than the number of interval boundaries.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartHistogram.AboveIntervalCount
member.summary: Gets the numeric count of values greater than the last interval.
member.remarks: Sometimes a data distribution will contain values that do not fall into any of the specified intervals of a histogram. The number of values numerically greater than the ending value of the last interval are returned by the AfterIntervalCount property.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.PlotFilterMethodEnum
member.summary: Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the property in the class.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries
member.summary: The ChartDataSeries class contains the data to be charted, as well as the properties and style object used to describe the appearance of the charted data.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.IsHole(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns true whenever the passed value will be interpreted as a data hole.
member.remarks: This method returns the identical value of the same method of the parent ChartData object.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new series that is a copy of the current series without data.
member.returns: An object containing the new ChartDataSeries.
member.remarks: The new ChartDataSeries object is not automatically added to the chart.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.DataLabel
member.summary: Gets the data label object.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.PlotFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the plot filter value which optimizes plotting large data arrays. The plot filter value represents the minimal distance from the previous data point in pixels. If distance is less than PlotFilter the point is not plotted. Only for XY-plot.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.PlotFilterMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the plot filter method. This property specifies method of optimization when plotting large data arrays. Only for XY-plot.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.FillStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill style of the data series.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.TooltipText
member.summary: Gets or sets the tooltip text.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.TooltipTextLegend
member.summary: Gets or sets the legend tooltip text.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Draw
member.summary: Occurs when series is drawing.

member.name: E:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.PostDraw
member.summary: Occurs after the series was drawn.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Group
member.summary: Gets the chart group.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the series label.
member.remarks: The series label is displayed in the legend element of the chart, along with appropriate line and symbol styles used to display the series data.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the series offset for appropriate charts.
member.remarks: The meaning, if any, of the series offset can change from chart type to chart type.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Length
member.summary: Gets the number of data points in the series.
member.remarks: The Length property returns the actual number of data points in the series. The length is the maximum number of elements in each of the relevant ChartDataArray objects in the series. ChartDataArray objects of the series are considered relevant only if the object is used to display the current ChartType.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.SeriesData
member.summary: Gets the current ChartDataSeries object. This property is only intended for use in the property browsers. It is not useful in code.

remarks.para: As a convenience, all relevant ChartDataSeries data arrays can be edited at the same time in a property browser by editing the SeriesData property. Data arrays are considered relevant only if the array is used to display the current ChartType.

For example, editing SeriesData for an XYPlot would invoke the data editor containing the X and Y data arrays. Editing SeriesData for a Candle chart would invoke the data editor containing the X, Y, Y1, Y2 and Y3 data arrays.
The SeriesData property is intended to be used only within property browsers, as it is merely a placeholder to allow invocation of the editor. The value returned is the object of which it is a part.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.PointData
member.summary: Gets the ChartDataArray object that manages point data (combined X and Y data).
member.remarks: The data managed by the ChartDataArray object referenced by the PointData property is exactly the same data as that manage by the ChartDataArray objects of the X and Y properties. The property is provided as a convenience when working with data obtained as Point or PointF values.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.X
member.summary: Gets the ChartDataArray object that manages X data.
member.remarks: The X property allows manipulation of the series X data alone. The X data managed by the ChartDataArray returned by the X property is the same data managed in the PointData and SeriesData properties.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Y
member.summary: Gets the ChartDataArray object that manages Y data.
member.remarks: The Y property allows manipulation of the series Y data alone. The Y data managed by the ChartDataArray returned by the Y property is the same data managed in the PointData and SeriesData properties.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Y1
member.summary: Gets the ChartDataArray object that manages Y1 data.

remarks.para: Y1 data is used for Hi-Lo, Hi-Lo-Open-Close, Candle and Bubble charts.
The Y1 data managed by the ChartDataArray returned by the Y1 property is the same data managed by the SeriesData property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Y2
member.summary: Gets the ChartDataArray object that manages Y2 data.

remarks.para: Y2 data is used for Hi-Lo-Open-Close and Candle charts.
The Y2 data managed by the ChartDataArray returned by the Y2 property is the same data managed by the SeriesData property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Y3
member.summary: Gets the ChartDataArray object that manages Y3 data.

remarks.para: Y3 data is used for Hi-Lo-Open-Close and Candle charts.
The Y3 data managed by the ChartDataArray returned by the Y3 property is the same data managed by the SeriesData property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.MaxX
member.summary: Returns the maximum X value of the series data.
member.remarks: This property searches the series for the maximum X value (excluding holes) each time it is called. If the value is to be used repeatedly within a loop, the value should be cached in a local variable.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.MinX
member.summary: Returns the minimum X value of the series point data array.
member.remarks: This property searches the series for the minimum X value (excluding holes) each time it is called. If the value is to be used repeatedly within a loop, the value should be cached in a local variable.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.MaxY
member.summary: Returns the maximum Y value of the series data.

remarks.para: This property searches the series for the maximum Y value (excluding holes) each time it is called. If the value is to be used repeatedly within a loop, the value should be cached in a local variable.
Note that all Y data arrays are searched, including Y, Y1, Y2, Y3 data arrays.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.MinY
member.summary: Returns the minimum Y value of the series point data array.

remarks.para: This property searches the series for the minimum Y value (excluding holes) each time it is called. If the value is to be used repeatedly within a loop, the value should be cached in a local variable.
Note that all Y data arrays are searched, including Y, Y1, Y2, Y3 data arrays.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.LineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the line style of the series, including color, thickness and pattern.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.SymbolStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the symbol style of the series, including color, size and shape.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.FitType
member.summary: Gets or sets the curve fit type.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Display
member.summary: Gets or sets the display of the series.
member.remarks: This property is used to show, hide or exclude the charting of the data series.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.LegendEntry
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the series label appears in the legend.
member.remarks: Occasionally, it is useful to chart a data series without including the series in the legend. Setting the LegendEntry property to false hides the series entry in the legend.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the Tag property which allows association of user data with the ChartDataSeries.
member.remarks: An Object that contains data about the ChartDataSeries. The default is a null reference (nothing in Visual Basic). Any type derived from the Object class can be assigned to this property. If the Tag property is set through the Windows Forms designer, only text may be assigned. A common use for the Tag property is to store data that is closely associated with the series.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartDataSeries.AutoEnumerate
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the X values of the series are automatically set to their index value.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartData.IsHole(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns true whenever the value passed will be interpreted as a data hole.
member.remarks: The value is automatically converted to the internal data type based upon the data type of the value specified. The value is then compared to the stored data hole. Note that indeterminate floating point data values including Infinity or NaN are treated as hole values.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartData.IsHole(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns true whenever the value passed will be interpreted as a data hole.
member.remarks: The value is automatically converted to the internal data type based upon the data type of the value specified. The value is then compared to the stored data hole. Note that indeterminate floating point data values including Infinity or NaN are treated as hole values.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartData.IsHole(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns true whenever the value passed will be interpreted as a data hole.
member.remarks: The value is automatically converted to the internal data type based upon the data type of the value specified. The value is then compared to the stored data hole. Note that indeterminate floating point data values including Infinity or NaN are treated as hole values.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartData.SetHole(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the data hole value, performing appropriate conversions from the passed object to the internal double storage value.
member.remarks: This method sets the hole value by passing any appropriate data type. The passed object is appropriately converted to the internal store value â€“ a double. The hole property can also be used to set the hole value, but only accepts double values.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartData.SaveDataToFile(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the contents of the current ChartData object to the specified file in XML format, including point data, holes and line and symbol style data.
member.remarks: This method saves the ChartData object contents to the specified file in XML format. If an error occurs during the file creation or writing, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartData.LoadDataFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the contents of the current ChartData object from the specified file in XML format, including point data, holes and line and symbol style data.
member.remarks: This method loads the current ChartData object with the contents for the specified file in XML format. The file specified should have been created with SaveDataToFile. If an error occurs during the file creation or writing, an appropriate exception is thrown indicating the cause of error.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Pie.Start
member.summary: Gets or sets the starting angle of the first Pie slice.
member.remarks: The angle is measured in degrees, and represents the arc between the most clockwise edge of the first slice and the right horizontal radius of the pie, as measured in the counter-clockwise direction.

member.summary: Gets or sets the offset value used to vary diameter of the pie within the charting area.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Pie.InnerRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the inner radius used for doughnut charts. A value greater than zero specifies the percentage of the full pie radius used for the doughnut hole.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether each series is drawn in the clockwise or counter-clockwise direction.

member.summary: The Bar class contains properties specific to Bar charts.
member.remarks: The Bar class and its properties are only used for bar charts. It is returned by the Bar property of a ChartGroup.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Bar.ClusterOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage that bar elements in the same cluster overlap.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Bar.ClusterWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage that each bar cluster occupies.
member.remarks: The percentage applies to the closest clusters.

member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance of a bar chart.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Bar.MultiRow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the 3D bar chart is plotted using multiple rows.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Bar.BarLines
member.summary: Gets or sets whether 2D stacked bar and column charts render lines from common series rectangles from one point to the next.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Bar.BarLineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the Color used for rendering BarLines indicated by the BarLines property.
member.remarks: Only applies to stacked bar and column charts.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Bar.BarLineThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness in pixels for rendering BarLines indicated by the BarLines property.
member.remarks: Only applies to stacked bar and column charts.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Bar.MixedStacking
member.summary: Gets or sets whether bar charts with mixed positive and negative values display both stacks at each point. Always True for 3D bars.
member.remarks: If True, postive values are stacked above the origin and negative values are stacked below the origin. If False, then the values are stacked by simple addition of values in series order.

remarks.para: The maximum and minimum bubble sizes represent the percentage of the diameter or area of the plot area, depending upon the value of the EncodingMethod property.
At this time the Bubble Method is always based on the diameter.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Bubble.MinimumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum bubble size in a bubble chart.
member.remarks: The minimum bubble size represents the percentage of the diameter (or area) of the plot area.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Bubble.MaximumSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum bubble size in a bubble chart.
member.remarks: The maximum bubble size represents the percentage of the diameter (or area) of the plot area.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.NormalCurve
member.summary: Contains all properties that help define the appearance of the normal curve for the Histogram chart.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.NormalCurve.ForegroundDisplay
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Normal (Gaussian) curve is displayed on top of the chart data display.
member.remarks: By default, the Normal (Gaussian) curve is displayed behind all charted data. Setting the ForegroundDisplay property to true specifies that the Normal curve should be drawn on top of the charted data.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.NormalCurve.LineStyle
member.summary: Gets of sets the ChartLineStyle object for the Normal curve.
member.remarks: The LineStyle property controls the appearance of the actual line drawn representing the Normal curve. The FillStyle property controls the appearance of the area under the Normal curve.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.NormalCurve.FillStyle
member.summary: Gets of sets the FillStyle object for the Normal curve.
member.remarks: The FillStyle property controls the appearance of the area under the Normal curve. The LineStyle property controls the appearance of the actual line drawn representing the Normal curve.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.NormalCurve.UseAntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Normal curve is drawn using anti-aliasing.
member.remarks: By default, the normal curve is drawn using anti-aliasing methods. Setting the UseAntiAlias property to false overrides this behavior.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.NormalCurve.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Normal curve is drawn.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.Histogram
member.summary: The ChartHistogram class contains properties specific to Histogram charts.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Histogram.Normalized
member.summary: Gets or sets whether each histogram series interval is normalized.
member.remarks: When histograms with non-uniform intervals are generated, each interval is typically normalized such that each interval height represents the same frequency per unit width. This preserves the most appropriate histogram shape.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Histogram.NormalizationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the normalization interval width.
member.remarks: When histograms with non-uniform intervals are generated, each interval is typically normalized such that each interval height represents the same frequency per unit width. This preserves the most appropriate histogram shape. The normalization interval width is the width to which all other intervals are normalized. Intervals with the same width as the normalization width, will have a height which directly indicates its value.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Histogram.NormalDisplay
member.summary: Gets an object describing a Gaussian normal curve display.
member.remarks: Histograms and frequency graphs are used to show the distribution of data values. Very often, the data distributions are compared to normal distributions. The properties of the NormalCurve object control the appearance of a built in display of a Normal (Gaussian) curve for comparison. The normal curve is unrelated to the data.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.Interaction
member.summary: Contains all properties that control the automated interactive features of the chart, including mouse driven rotation, scaling, translating and zooming.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Interaction.Appearance
member.summary: Gets or sets the interaction appearance.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Interaction.Actions
member.summary: Gets the collection of available interactive actions.

remarks.para:
The following actions are available:
Rotate - rotate chart (only for chart with 3D effects),
Scale - change scale of chart,
Translate - scroll through chart,
Zoom - select rectangular area of chart for view.

Scale, translate and zoom actions are available for charts with Cartesian axes. All actions are invoked when user drags the mouse over plot area with the specified keyboard modifier(ALT, CONTROL, SHIFT).

The default action map includes the following actions:
rotate - left mouse button,
scale - CONTROL + left mouse button,
translate - SHIFT + left mouse button,
zoom - ALT + left mouse button.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Interaction.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the chart interaction is enabled.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Interaction.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the interaction settings are the same as the default interaction settings.

remarks.para: If the interaction settings are set to their default values, then IsDefault returns true. If the interaction settings are not set to their default values, then IsDefault returns false.
If IsDefault is explicitly set to true, then the interaction settings are reset to their default values.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.AttachMethodEnum
member.summary: Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the property in the class.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.AttachMethodEnum.Coordinate
member.summary: Label can be attached to anywhere on the chart. The number of pixels between the top-left corner of the chart to the ChartLabel can be specified.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.AttachMethodEnum.DataCoordinate
member.summary: Label is attached to anywhere inside the PlotArea. The data coordinates can be specified. This method is not allowed on pie charts using PointLabels for the X-axis annotation. If any part of the ChartLabel falls outside of the ChartArea, it is clipped.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.AttachMethodEnum.DataIndex
member.summary: Label is attached to a specific data point on the chart. The series and point indices and the ChartGroup can be specified.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.AttachMethodEnum.DataIndexY
member.summary: Label is attached to a distance above or below a specific data point. The series and point indices, the ChartGroup, and the Y-coordinate can be specified. This is most useful for bar and stacking bar charts.

member.summary: PointStyle is used to describe a data point that has different appearance from other data points in the same data series. When applied to a specific data point, the properties of a PointStyle object supersede those specified by the data series containing the data point. To Understand the full meaning of these properties in the context of different chart types, please refer to the context of the style properties associated with each series.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray
member.summary: Container object for data arrays.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.IsHole(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if the specified value is interpreted as a data hole.
member.returns: A boolean value indicating whether the specified value is interpreted as a data hole.
member.remarks: The value is automatically converted to the internal data type based upon the data type of the value specified. The value is then compared to the stored data hole. Note that invalid floating point data values such as NaN are treated as hole values.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.CopyDataIn(System.Object)
member.summary: Copies data into the ChartCoordArray, replacing all existing data.
member.returns: A Boolean value indicating whether the data was appropriately copied into the ChartCoordArray.

remarks.para: Although the passed data array is an object, the underlying data type must be an array of type Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal or DateTime (VB) or float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal or DateTime (C#). An array of objects is not accepted. When PointData is managed by the ChartCoordArray, an array PointF objects may also be passed.

Note that all values are stored as a Double(VB) or double(C#) data type internally. Data conversions are performed automatically and as appropriate for the inputted data type. For example, setting a data element to a DateTime value of January 1, 2002 will be stored internally as an Ole date, then converted to a Double/double with a result of 37257.
Additionally, the length of the copied array defines the length of the ChartCoordArray, and the Length property will report the new value.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.CopyDataOut
member.summary: Copies data out of the ChartCoordArray using the default data type.
member.returns: An object containing an array of the default type, appropriately converted from the internal Double(VB) or double(C#) values.
member.remarks:
Although the returned array is an object, the underlying data type will be an array of type Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal or DateTime (VB) or float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal or DateTime (C#). When PointData is managed by the ChartCoordArray, an array PointF objects may also be returned.
In Visual Basic, it is not necessary to explicitly cast the returned value. The strong typing of C# however, requires an explicit cast.
Note that all values are stored as a Double(VB) or double(C#) data type internally. Data conversions are performed automatically and as appropriate for the default data type.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.CopyDataOut(System.Type)
member.summary: Copies data out of the ChartCoordArray using the specified data type.
member.returns: An object containing an array of the specified type, appropriately converted from the internal Double(VB) or double(C#) values.
member.remarks:
Although the returned array is an object, the underlying data type will be an array of type Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal or DateTime (VB) or float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal or DateTime (C#). When PointData is managed by the ChartCoordArray, an array PointF objects may also be returned.
In Visual Basic, it is not necessary to explicitly cast the returned value. The strong typing of C# however, requires an explicit cast.
Note that all values are stored as a Double(VB) or double(C#) data type internally. Data conversions are performed automatically and as appropriate for the specified data type.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.Add(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a new value to the end of the ChartCoordArray.
member.returns: An integer indicating the index of the new value in the ChartCoordArray. The new index is always the Length of the ChartCoordArray prior to adding the new value.
member.remarks: The Add method extends the length of the ChartCoordArray by one, then adds the new value to the newly created element. The value is automatically converted to the internal storage data type.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.Clear
member.summary: Removes all values from the ChartCoordArray.
member.remarks: All elements of the ChartCoordArray are removed and the Length is set to 0.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.Contains(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether a value is in the ChartCoordArray.
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether the specified value can be found in one of the elements of the ChartCoordArray.
member.remarks: The value is automatically converted to the internal data type based upon the data type of the value specified. The value and the elements of the ChartCoordArray are then compared using the converted result.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.IndexOf(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets the current index of the specified value in the ChartCoordArray.
member.returns: Returns an integer indicating the element of the specified value within the ChartCoordArray. If the value is not found the return value is â€“1.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts a new value at the specified index of the ChartCoordArray.
member.remarks: The value is inserted at the position specified and the length of the ChartCoordArray is increased by 1.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.Remove(System.Object)
member.summary: Removes the first occurrence of the specified value from the ChartCoordArray.
member.remarks: The value is automatically converted to the internal data type based upon the data type of the value specified. The value and the elements of the ChartCoordArray are then compared using the converted result.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the specified index from the ChartCoordArray.
member.param: Index of data value to remove
member.remarks: The element of the ChartCoordArray is removed, and the length of the ChartCoordArray is decreased by 1.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.DataType
member.summary: Gets or sets the default data type of the coord.
member.remarks: Specifies the default data type that is used with the CopyDataOut method. If the default DataType property is not explicitly set, then the reported type is that of the last entered data through either the CopyDataIn method of the Item property. Acceptable input data types include Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal and DateTime (VB) and float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal and DateTime (C#). When PointData is managed by the ChartCoordArray, PointF objects may also be used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the coord array.
member.remarks: When extending the existing length of the array, the newly created elements are filled with data hole values. When reducing the length of the array, truncated elements are thrown away. Note that it may be necessary to increase the length of an array before setting its values with the Item property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.Hole
member.summary: Returns an Object with the current data hole value converted to the data type specified by the ChartCoordArray.DataType property.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.ChartCoordArray.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the data element by index.

remarks.para: This property can be used to access a specific data entry by numerical index. In Visual Basic, no casting is required. In C#, it is necessary to cast the return value to the appropriate type. Note that all values are stored as a Double(VB) or double(C#) data type internally. Data conversions are performed automatically and as appropriate for the inputted data type. For example, setting a data element to a DateTime value of January 1, 2002 will be stored internally as an Ole date, then converted to a Double/double with a result of 37257.

Acceptable input data types include Single, Double, Integer, Int16, Int64, Decimal and DateTime (VB) and float, double, int, Int16, Int64, decimal and DateTime (C#). When PointData is managed by the ChartCoordArray, PointF objects may also be used.
Note that the index must be between 0 and the Length of the array inclusive.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.LightDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points and are spaced 50 percent closer together than ForwardDiagonal, but they are not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.LightUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points and are spaced 50 percent closer together than BackwardDiagonal, but they are not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.DarkDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points, are spaced 50 percent closer together than, and are twice the width of ForwardDiagonal. This hatch pattern is not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.DarkUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points, are spaced 50 percent closer together than BackwardDiagonal, and are twice its width, but the lines are not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.WideDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points, have the same spacing as hatch style ForwardDiagonal, and are triple its width, but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.WideUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points, have the same spacing as hatch style BackwardDiagonal, and are triple its width, but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.LightVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Vertical.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.LightHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Horizontal.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.NarrowVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 75 percent closer together than hatch style Vertical (or 25 percent closer together than LightVertical).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.NarrowHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 75 percent closer together than hatch style Horizontal (or 25 percent closer together than LightHorizontal).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.DarkVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Vertical and are twice its width.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.DarkHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Horizontal and are twice its width.

member.summary: Specifies dashed diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points.

member.summary: Specifies dashed horizontal lines.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.HatchStyleEnum.DashedVertical

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.LegendOrientationEnum
member.summary: Use the members of this enumeration to set the value of the in the class.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.LegendOrientationEnum.Auto
member.summary: Horizontal for legends with north and south Compass values, and Vertical for legends with east and west Compass values.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.LegendOrientationEnum.Vertical
member.summary: Legend entries are added side by side as (horizontally) as legend width permits. If sufficient width is not available, additional legend rows are created.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.LegendOrientationEnum.Horizontal
member.summary: Legend entries are stacked vertically as legend height permits. If sufficient height is not available, additional legend columns are created.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Legend.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the legend entries.

remarks.para: The legend entries can be oriented in a vertical or horizontal fashion.

Vertical orientation indicates that legend entries will stack vertically as the legend height permits. If the legend height cannot contain all of the entries and the legend is allowed to size itself, then additional columns of stacked entries will be added to the legend.

Horizontal orientation indicates that legend entries will be created side by side as legend width permits. If the legend width cannot contain all of the entries and the legend is allowed to size itself, then additional rows of entries will be added to the legend.

Auto orientation automatically selects an appropriate orientation based upon the legend Compass property. For east and west Compass values, Vertical orientation is used. For north and south Compass values, Horizontal orientation is used.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis
member.summary: The Axis class describes the axis of the chart.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.ShouldSerializeForeColor
member.summary: Returns false if the Axis ForeColor property is in the default state.
member.remarks: The default state is to inherit the ForeColor from the ChartArea object.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.ResetForeColor
member.summary: Resets the inheritance state of the axis forecolor.
member.remarks: This method resets the inheritance state of the axis forecolor. By default, the forecolor used for the axis is that specified by the ChartArea style. In the inherited state, any changes to the ChartArea style are reflected in the axis forecolor. However, if the forecolor for the axis is explicitly changed, changing the ChartArea style forecolor no longer affects the axis style. Calling ResetForecolor() restores the inherited state, so once again the forecolor used by the axis will be the same as that specified by the ChartArea style.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.ShouldSerializeFont
member.summary: Returns false if the Axis Font property is in the default state.
member.remarks: The default state is to inherit the font from the ChartArea object.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.ResetFont
member.summary: Resets the inheritance state of the axis font.
member.remarks: This method resets the inheritance state of the axis font. By default, the font used for the axis is that specified by the ChartArea style. In the inherited state, any changes to the ChartArea style are reflected in the axis font. However, if the font for the axis is explicitly changed, changing the ChartArea style font no longer affects the axis style. Calling ResetFont() restores the inherited state, so once again the font used by the axis will be the same as that specified by the ChartArea style.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color.

remarks.para: Inherits from the . The ForeColor is used to set the color of the axis line and annotations.

Associated with the ForeColor Property, is the ResetForeColor() method. This method restores the inheritance state for the axis forecolor. If a forecolor is explicitly set for an axis, it no longer inherits from the ChartArea, so changing the ChartArea forecolor no longer affects or changes the axis value. Calling ResetForecolor () restores the inherited state so changes to the ChartArea font will once again change the axis forecolor.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the font object.

remarks.para: Inherits from the .

Associated with the Font Property, is the ResetFont() method. This method restores the inheritance state for the axis font. If a font is explicitly set for an axis, it no longer inherits from the ChartArea; so changing the ChartArea font no longer affects or changes the axis value. Calling ResetFont() restores the inherited state so changes to the ChartArea font will once again change the axis font.

member.summary: Gets the axis name.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.AnnotationRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the clockwise angle of rotation for the axis annotations.
member.remarks: The angle of rotation is always specified in degrees. Rotations between +/- 30 to +/- 60 degrees are ideal for X-axis annotation when a large number of labels are desired.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.AnnoFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation format for the axis.

remarks.para: The AnnoFormat property allow specification of numeric and time formats using enumerated values.

For numeric values, each of the enumerations specify formatting similar to that specified by the .Net , including Currency, General, Exponential, Percentage, Roundtrip and Hexadecimal. NumericManual is used in conjunction with the AnnoFormatString property to specify a custom format string.

For date/time values, each of the enumerations specify formatting similar to that specified by the .Net class, including combinations of long and short dates and times, and universal time representations. DateManual is used in conjunction with the AnnoFormatString property to specify a custom format string.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.AnnoFormatString
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation format string used with manual formats.

remarks.para: Only used when property is NumericManual or DateManual. The AnnoFormatString property specifies a custom string for formatting the annotations along the axis.

When the AnnoFormat property is NumericManual, the AnnoFormatString property can be set to format strings as described by the .Net double.ToString(AnnoFormatString) method call. Custom numeric format strings are described in detail by the .Net documentation under â€œCustom Numeric Format Stringsâ€. If the AnnoFormatString property is empty, then â€œgâ€ or General is used.

When the AnnoFormat property is DateManual, the AnnoFormatString property can be set to format string as described by the .Net DateTime.ToString(AnnoFormatSTring) method call. Custom DateTime format strings are described in detail by the .Net documentation under â€œDate and Time Format Stringsâ€. If the AnnoFormatString property is empty, then C1Chart selects a format string appropriate for the time span defined by the axis maximum and minimum values.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.AutoMin
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the axis minimum value is calculated automatically.
member.remarks: Setting the property automatically sets to false.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.TickMajor
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of major tick mark.
member.remarks: Tick marks can be place on either side or both sides of the axis line. Note that if the TickMajor property is set to then major tick marks are not drawn.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.TickMinor
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of minor tick mark.
member.remarks: Tick marks can be placed on either side or both sides of the axis line. Note that if the TickMinor property is set to , then minor tick marks are not drawn.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.TickFactorMajor
member.summary: Gets or sets an integral factor for major tick mark length.
member.remarks: Tick marks are sized based on the thickness of the axis line as well as the tick factor. Doubling the tick factor doubles the length of the axis tick mark. Values are limited to integers from 1 to 20. Values outside of this range are ignored.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.TickFactorMinor
member.summary: Gets or sets an integral factor for minor tick mark length.
member.remarks: Tick marks are sized based on the thickness of the axis line as well as the tick factor. Doubling the tick factor doubles the length of the axis tick mark. Values are limited to integers from 1 to 20. Values outside of this range are ignored.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.TickGauge
member.summary: Gets or sets the approximate number of intervals delineated by gauge marks between major tick marks.
member.remarks: Gauge marks are oversized minor tick marks used to subdivide minor ticks for easy reading. Use 0 for none (default), 1 for automatic and > 1 for approximate number of sections of minor tick marks delimited by gauge marks between each set of major tick marks.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.NoAnnoOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether axis annotations are permitted to overlap.
member.remarks: Setting NoAnnoOverlap suppresses the drawing of any axis annotation that would overlap a previously drawn annotation regardless of the reason for the overlap. This property does not change scaling or generation of major and minor tick marks. The property is not normally required for applications with AutoMajor set to true.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.TickLabels
member.summary: Gets or sets the placement of the annotation labels relative the axis.
member.remarks: Axis annotations can be placed on the chart in several positions or not at all. See the Enumeration for details.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.GridMajor
member.summary: Gets or sets the major grid lines object.
member.remarks: Major grids are placed coincident with major tick marks at intervals. The GridMajor property is used to set the grid line appearance.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.GridMinor
member.summary: Gets or sets the minor grid lines object.
member.remarks: Minor grids are placed coincident with minor tick marks at intervals. The GridMinor property is used to set the grid line appearance.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.AnnoMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation method used.
member.remarks: AnnotationMethodEnum has two possible values, ValueLabels or Values. Values annotation can be used with any chart type in any instance. ValueLablels annotation cannot be used on the X-axis and the Y-axis for Pie charts.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.ValueLabels
member.summary: Gets the object.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.OnTop
member.summary: Gets or sets whether axis and gridlines appear on top of the chart image.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.Compass
member.summary: Gets or sets the general positioning of the axis.
member.remarks: X may be set to North/South, Y and Y2 may be set to East/West.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis visibility.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.IsLogarithmic
member.summary: Gets or sets when the axis is scaled logarithmically.
member.remarks: Logarithmic scaling does not make mathematical sense when values are less than or equal to zero. Therefore, negative and zero values are not plotted against axes that have the IsLogarithmic property set to true.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Chart.YFunction
member.summary: The Yfunction class is used to describe simple functions defined explicitly by equations of the form y(x) = f(x).

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.YFunction.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor is equivalent to YFunction(true).

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Chart.YFunction.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Specifies whether the YFunction object should be created in a way that allows the compiled functions (in-memory assemblies) be unloaded.
When the Disposable parameter is true, an in-memory assembly is created another AppDomain which is unloaded from the application when the YFunction object goes out of scope. If the Disposable parameter is false, then the in-memory created assemblies cannot be unloaded until the application is terminated. Note that an AppDomain is used only if the current permission set allows. Web applications always create function assemblies in the current AppDomain.

member.summary: Calculates the value of the function at specified X value.

member.summary: Calculates the values of the function at specified X values.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the maximum X value is calculated automatically.
member.remarks: When AutoMax is true the AxisX.Max is used.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.YFunction.AutoMin
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the minimum X value is calculated automatically.
member.remarks: When AutoMin is true the AxisX.Min is used as minimum x.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.YFunction.CodeText
member.summary: Gets or sets the function code.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.YFunction.CustomFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets a user-defined custom function object.
member.remarks: To obtain complete control of the Yfunction calculation, a class inheriting from can be implemented and instantiated. After the CustomFunction property is set to an instance of such a class object, the chart will plot the user-defined with the appropriate styles and legend entry.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum X value of the plotted function.
member.remarks: Setting MaxX changes the to false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum X value of the plotted function.
member.remarks: Setting MinX changes the to false.

member.summary: Represents a function defined by a pair of equations, x(t) = f1(t) and y(t) = f2(t), where t is an independent variable.

member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Specifies whether the ParametricFunction object should be created in a way that allows the compiled functions (in-memory assemblies) be unloaded.
When the Disposable parameter is true, an in-memory assembly is created another AppDomain which is unloaded from the application when the ParametricFunction object goes out of scope. If the Disposable parameter is false, then the in-memory created assemblies cannot be unloaded until the application is terminated. Note that an AppDomain is used only if the current permission set allows. Web applications always create function assemblies in the current AppDomain.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.TrendLineTypeEnum.Polynom
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 + C1*x + C2*x2 + â€¦ + Cn-1*xn-1, where n â€“ number of terms.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.TrendLineTypeEnum.Exponent
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 * exp( C1*x).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.TrendLineTypeEnum.Logarithmic
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 * ln(C1*x).

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.TrendLineTypeEnum.Power
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 * x C1.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.TrendLineTypeEnum.Fourier
member.summary: Regression fit to the equation Y(x) = C0 + C1 * cos(x) + C2 * sin(x) + C3 * cos(2*x) + C4 * sin(2*x) + â€¦

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Chart.TrendLineTypeEnum.MovingAverage
member.summary: Moving average of y data values Yi = ( yi + yi-1 + yi-2 + â€¦ + yi-p+1 ) / p, where p â€“ period.

member.summary: Minimum of y data values.

member.summary: Gets or sets the object that provides a user-defined calculation of the TrendLine.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.TrendLine.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text associated with the TrendLine shown in legend.
member.remarks:
Text property can contains keywords that are replaced with appropriate value when rendering legend. The keyword must be in brackets. KeywordValue
#DSLABELLabel of appropriate data series
#TRENDTYPEType of trend line
#SHORTTRENDTYPEShort type of trend line
#NTERMSNumber of terms for regression trend line
#PERIODPeriod for moving average trend line
#FORMULAFormula of regression equation

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Chart.TrendLine.RegressionStatistics
member.summary: Gets the statistical information about calculated regression.
member.remarks: This property is meaningful only for TrendLines that use a specific regression model, including Polynomial, Log, Power. Exponential, or Fourier. For TrendLines that do not use one of these regression models, Nothing (VB) or null (C#) is returned. If data can not be fit to the specified regression model also returns Nothing.(VB) or null (C#).
